title: Pats' Diggs faces strangulation, assault charges
content: Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs is facing a felony charge of strangulation and a misdemeanor charge of assault from alleged Dec. 2 incident.

title: Cowboys release two-time Pro Bowl CB Diggs
content: The Cowboys have released cornerback Trevon Diggs. He will become a free agent if he goes unclaimed on waivers.

title: Edgecombe's last-second 3 propels Sixers in OT
content: Rookie VJ Edgecombe rewarded the Sixers' faith in him by connecting on a tiebreaking 25-foot jumper with 1.7 seconds left, lifting Philadelphia to a 139-136 win over the Grizzlies.

title: NCAA clarifies eligibility stance amid criticism
content: President Charlie Baker clarified the NCAA's position on college eligibility for players with NBA experience Tuesday, saying "it has not and will not grant eligibility to any prospective or returning student-athletes who have signed an NBA contract."

title: CMC misses Tue. practice ahead of Seahawks tilt
content: Niners star Christian McCaffrey missed Tuesday's practice with a stiff back, while left tackle Trent Williams nursed a right hamstring injury ahead of Saturday's showdown with the Seahawks.

title: Sources: Bulls' Giddey out at least a few weeks
content: Bulls guard Josh Giddey will miss at least a few weeks after straining his left hamstring in Monday's loss to the Timberwolves, sources told ESPN.

title: Williams nixes portal talk, declares Bama return
content: Alabama wide receiver Ryan Williams intends to return to the team in 2026 despite a bumpy sophomore season.

title: Duke lands prized PG Rippey; '26 class now No. 1
content: Duke moved atop the 2026 recruiting class rankings after Deron Rippey Jr., the No. 3-ranked point guard in the country, became the Blue Devils' third five-star commitment.

content: From Indiana to James Madison, we picked out every CFP player who could factor into the 2026 NFL draft.

content: Jey and Jimmy Uso take back the tag titles on 'Raw,' setting the stage for more championship action on Jan. 5.

content: Which lines offered value once odds came out? Here are games we are eyeing for bets going into Week 18.

title: Man gets life term for raising module of Pakistan based terror outfit in Assam
content: Md Kamruj Zaman alias Kamaruddin was awarded three separate punishments under provisions of an anti-terror law, with the maximum of life imprisonment, by an NIA special court in Guwahati, Assam

title: Dense fog blankets Delhi, AQI stays in 'very poor' category
content: The national capital recorded a 24-hour average Air Quality Index (AQI) of 384, according to data from the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB)

title: Prem Anand Sinha is Avadi Police Commissioner
content: Before being posted to South Zone, Mr. Sinha served in Chennai city as Additional Commissioner of Police, South

title: Panneerselvam slams DMK government over attack on Odisha man
content: Panneerselvam criticised the DMK government over the Tiruttani attack by four minors, alleging it exposed Tamil Nadu‚Äôs growing drug menace and urging urgent action.

content: He was the second Commissioner of Tambaram commissionerate, which was inaugurated on January 1, 2022¬†

content: The bus, operating a service under Budget Tourism Cell, from Malappuram depot was en route to Gavi in Pathanamthitta when the incident happened

content: Why the State‚Äôs borrowing looks less ‚Äòalarming‚Äô, once growth, per capita income and human development are taken into account; moreover, when 75% of revenue comes from the State‚Äôs own resources, how should debates on outstanding debt factor in tax capacity and cooperative federalism?

content: Gig workers with platforms such as Swiggy, Zepto, Blinkit, Zomato, Amazon, and Flipkart are planning to take part in a nationwide strike on December 31

content: The controversy transpired when a functionary of her party, out of his ‚Äúdesperation to demonstrate loyalty‚Äù to the leader, got hoardings and posters put up in the State capital, depicting the Chief Minister as Virgin Mary, on the eve of her birthday in February 1995

content: Chamoli District Magistrate Gaurav Kumar said that there were a total of 109 people on the train at the time of the accident

title: Manipur BJP legislator first Indian to receive 5th Dan in traditional taekwondo
content: Yumnam Khemchand Singh could not visit Seoul when he earned the black belt rank in October 2024 due to the ethnic violence in Manipur

content: Saini said the resolve of his government was ‚ÄúSabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas aur Sabka Prayas‚Äù

content: Khandwa district administration, however, has rejected the allegations saying that the AI-generated images were uploaded on a portal that has nothing to do with the award

title: Nitish cabinet likely to be expanded after January 15
content: Party insiders in JD(U) told The Hindu that the Cabinet could be expanded after the inauspicious month of kharmas which goes from mid-December to mid-January

content: Shah is a prominent businessman¬†who also served as president of the Kashmir Chamber of Commerce and Industries (KCCI) and also as the chairman of the Joint Cross-LoC Chamber

title: The Hemant Soren government is offering ‚Äúlollipops‚Äù to tribals in the name of PESA: Raghubar Das
content: He alleged that through these rules, an attempt is being made to weaken the traditional Gram Sabha system of various tribal communities such as the Santhal, Ho, Kharia, Oraon, Munda and Bhumij.

title: Bihar government to revive old sugar mills
content: Cooperative Minister to launch membership-cum-awareness drive at panchayat level from Jan 2, in order to create awareness among people about its schemes and also to carry out a membership drive of PACS.

title: India is now fourth largest economy, says govt.
content: The government says that with the GDP valued at $4.18 trillion, ‚ÄúIndia has surpassed Japan to become the world‚Äôs fourth largest economy‚Äù, it says that the country is ‚Äúpoised to displace Germany from the third rank‚Äù with a projected GDP of $7.3 trillion by 2030

title: Cybercrime cases recorded a decline in NTR District this year
content: Overall crime rate went down by 21.66%, while property offences, crimes against women, POCSO cases, road accidents also recorded a decline

title: A.P. HC directs VMC to shift destitute people to shelter homes
content: MA&UD Department told to file an affidavit on steps that can be taken to ensure that destitute people, both men and women, do not sleep on pavement

title: China ‚Äòmediated‚Äô in Pakistan, India tensions: Wang Yi
content: China's role in the May 7-10 Operation Sindoor conflict between India and Pakistan this year came under serious scrutiny and criticism, especially the military assistance provided by Beijing to Islamabad

title: Rajasthan Cabinet approves new vehicle scrapping policy
content: Cabinet also gives green light for the second revised cost proposal for the oil refinery at Pachpadra

title: 'Remove 10 mins delivery option': Gig workers launch nationwide strike on New Year's Eve
content: Gig workers are demanding the removal of 10-minute delivery options and the reinstatement of earlier payout structures ahead of a nationwide strike. Thousands of workers are participating, citing unsafe pressure and reduced earnings due to changes in payment systems and algorithm-driven management. The protest, organized by IFAT, aims to address these concerns and secure social security benefits.

title: NRI dies after pistol in waist misfires in Punjab
content: A tragic accident claimed the life of Harwinder Singh, an NRI who had recently returned home, in Fazilka's Dhani Sucha Singh village. A pistol tucked in his waist accidentally discharged as he stood up, striking him fatally. The incident, captured on CCTV, led to his death en route to a hospital. Local leaders expressed sorrow for the family's loss.

title: Haryana horror : Suitcase with woman‚Äôs body found on roadside
content: A disturbing discovery was made in Haryana's Kaithal district as a woman's body was found stuffed inside a blue suitcase in a drain. Farmers alerted authorities after noticing dogs with the luggage. The unidentified victim, believed to be around 30, showed signs of strangulation.

title: Australia cricket great Damien Martyn in induced coma
content: Former Australian cricketer Damien Martyn has been hospitalised and placed in an induced coma after being diagnosed with meningitis. The 54-year-old, a prominent player for Australia in Tests and ODIs, fell ill on Boxing Day. Friends and former teammates have sent their well wishes and prayers for his recovery.

title: Neuralink and parenting: Meta AI chief Alexandr Wang on kids; will wait until Neuralink advances
content: Meta's AI head, Alexandr Wang, revealed he will delay having children until advanced brain-computer interface (BCI) technology like Neuralink is widely available. Wang believes children's early neuroplasticity offers a prime window for intuitive BCI integration, potentially enabling future generations to learn and utilize superintelligence tools more effectively than adults.

title: Happy New Year 2026: Best wishes and images to share on New Year's Eve
content: As 2026 dawns, New Year's Eve messages are shifting from grand pronouncements to heartfelt, honest sentiments. People seek genuine wishes for peace, health, and calm, acknowledging life's complexities. The focus  is on shared moments and simple hopes, moving away from toxic positivity towards messages that offer comfort and connection, making them more meaningful than ever.

title: Zelenskyy says allies can 'verify' Putin home attack 'was fake'
content: Ukraine said Tuesday there was no "plausible" evidence it launched a drone attack on one of Russian President Vladimir Putin's residences, accusing Moscow of peddling falsehoods to manipulate talks on ending the war. It also said the Russian army had chosen "how, when and where" to retaliate against Ukraine, and that Moscow would now "toughen" its negotiating position in talks to end Europe's worst conflict since World War Two.

title: Pakistan: Asim Munir marries daughter to brother‚Äôs son; top officials in attendance
content: Pakistan army chief Asim Munir's daughter recently married her cousin, Abdul Rehman, in a subdued ceremony in Rawalpindi. The event saw attendance from top political and military figures, including the President and PM.

title: Chinese tycoon with over 100 children eyes 20 US-born kids for video game business
content: Chinese billionaire Xu Bo reportedly aims to father at least 20 US-born children to inherit his $1.1 billion gaming fortune, bypassing domestic birth restrictions. This mirrors a trend among ultra-wealthy men like Pavel Durov and Elon Musk, who are also expanding their biological legacies through modern means.

title: Telangana man digs his grave beside wife‚Äôs resting place; calls it 'final home'
content: An 80-year-old man in Jagtial district has dug his own granite grave, costing Rs 12 lakh, to avoid burdening his children. Nakka Indrayya, who spent 45 years in Dubai's construction, visits and tends to his resting place daily, finding peace in his preparations for death.

title: 'To build peace that lasts': After Trump, China claims credit for mediating India-Pak conflict
content: China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi claimed Beijing mediated the India-Pakistan standoff in May following the Pahalgam terror attack. This assertion comes despite India's consistent dismissal of third-party mediation, stating the conflict was resolved through direct military-to-military communication after Pakistan's DGMO requested a ceasefire.

title: Billionaire exodus: Two tech tycoons upset with Silicon Valley; may leave by tomorrow
content: Tech titans Peter Thiel and Larry Page are reportedly planning to leave California before year-end, fearing a proposed 5% wealth tax on billionaires. The measure, if passed and retroactive, could cost them billions. While some politicians dismiss these threats, others warn of an exodus of talent and investment from the Golden State.

title: Gold price prediction: What‚Äôs the outlook for gold, silver prices? What you should know
content: Gold price prediction today: Maneesh Sharma of Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers is of the view that gold and silver prices are set for the best annual performances in several years.

title: Gurgaon horror: Woman raped, assaulted after taking lift; thrown from moving van
content: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly raped and assaulted by two men after accepting a lift in a van on the Gurgaon-Faridabad road. She was held captive for nearly three hours and then thrown from the moving vehicle, sustaining severe facial injuries. Police have detained two suspects following a complaint.

title: Uttarakhand: 2 loco trains collide in Vishnugad-Pipalkoti hydroelectric project; 60 injured
content: A collision between two trains inside the Pipalkoti tunnel of the Vishnugad‚ÄìPipalkoti Hydroelectric Project has left approximately 60 people injured. A loco train carrying workers and officials struck a goods train, with 109 individuals on board. All injured have been rescued and are in stable condition. The incident occurred within the project area, being developed by THDC (India).

title: Will NSE and BSE remain closed or open for trading on Jan 1, 2026?
content: Indian stock markets, NSE and BSE, will remain open on January 1, 2026, offering a rare trading opportunity as global exchanges close for New Year celebrations. The NSE has also unveiled its 2026 holiday calendar, detailing 15 trading closures throughout the year, including major festivals and national holidays.

title: The Berlin visa trap: Why Indian students are being asked to leave despite being enrolled
content: Hundreds of Indian students at a private Berlin university face deportation as their residence permits are not being renewed. Authorities deemed their hybrid study programmes, combining online and limited in-person classes, insufficient for a student visa under German law. This ruling leaves many mid-degree, facing significant financial losses and academic uncertainty.

title: Bank holiday on New Year: Will banks remain closed on Dec 31 & Jan 1? Check list
content: As 2025 concludes, Indian banks will observe varied closures on December 31 and January 1. Mizoram and Arunachal Pradesh will shut on New Year's Eve, while several other states, including Tamil Nadu and West Bengal, will close on January 1 for New Year's Day and local festivals. Digital banking remains accessible for essential transactions.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 26,000; BSE Sensex up over 200 points
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in green on the last day of the calendar year 2025. While Nifty50 was above 26,000, BSE Sensex rose over 200 points.

title: Neerja Modi School suicide case: CBSE cites 'gross violations of child safety norms'; withdraws affiliation
content: The CBSE has revoked Neerja Modi School's affiliation up to senior secondary level following a 9-year-old student's death due to alleged gross violations of child safety norms. The board cited a complete failure in the school's counselling and grievance redressal systems, deeming the environment unsafe.

title: Near-zero visibility in Delhi: Dense fog disrupts flight ops, rail traffic; AQI ‚Äòvery poor‚Äô
content: Dense fog significantly disrupted travel in Delhi on Wednesday, leading to flight cancellations and delays at IGI Airport. Operations are underway using CAT III protocols, though passengers are advised to check with airlines for updates. Air quality remained in the 'very poor' category.

title: World Blitz: Magnus Carlsen clinches record ninth title; Arjun Erigaisi wins bronze
content: Magnus Carlsen secured his ninth World Blitz title, defeating Nodirbek Abdusattorov 2.5-1.5 after a dramatic final. Indian Grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi, who led the qualifying rounds, fell in the semifinals and secured a bronze medal, his second of the championship.

title: Drill, dash, disappear: Robbers crack German bank vault; vanish with $35m
content: Robbers drilled into a bank vault in Gelsenkirchen, Germany, making off with approximately $35 million in cash, gold, and jewelry. The suspects successfully breached over 3,000 safe deposit boxes before escaping. Authorities are currently investigating the incident, and the perpetrators remain at large.

title: Pahalgam attack, Air India plane crash & more: Why 2025 felt like a year of endless crises
content: 2025 was a year of profound loss, marked by a series of devastating events across India and globally. From deadly stampedes at religious gatherings and railway stations to a catastrophic earthquake in Myanmar and Thailand, the year witnessed widespread tragedy.

title: Athletes who died in 2025: Greg Biffle, George Foreman, Ricky Hatton and more
content: The sports world mourned the loss of numerous athletes in 2025, from Hall of Fame legends to champions who defined their eras. Notable figures like George Foreman, Hulk Hogan, and Greg Biffle, along with baseball stars Ryne Sandberg and Dave Parker, passed away. The year's tributes spanned across football, hockey, basketball, and golf, remembering icons who left indelible legacies.

title: World record: Deepti Sharma becomes highest wicket-taker in women's T20Is - Full list inside
content: Deepti Sharma has become the leading wicket-taker in women's T20 Internationals, surpassing Megan Schutt with her 152nd wicket. This achievement comes after she also became the first cricketer to score 1,000 runs and take 150 wickets in T20Is. India secured a 5-0 series win against Sri Lanka.

title: UP panchayat bans 'nikah' at hotels: DJs, fireworks, salami restricted;
content: A Muslim community panchayat in Kosi Kalan has banned nikah ceremonies at hotels and guest houses, restricting DJ music, fireworks, and the 'salami' ritual to curb extravagance. The move aims to promote austerity and equality, with repeated violations incurring an Rs 11,000 fine. Nikahs will now be solemnized only in mosques.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection day 26: Ranveer Singh starrer to soar past Rs 1,100 crore mark
content: Aditya Dhar's spy-thriller 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, is dominating the box office, nearing Rs 712.25 crore in domestic net collections after 26 days. The film has achieved the biggest Bollywood grosser status with Rs 854.75 crore gross and a staggering Rs 1095.5 crore worldwide. It's now challenging 'Jawan's' record.

title: Bengaluru shocker: 26-year-old Biocon employee dies after jumping from office building
content: A 26-year-old Biocon employee, Anant Kumar, died after allegedly jumping from the fifth floor of the company's building in Electronics City. Police stated Kumar was seen walking out of the canteen before going to the terrace and jumping. The reason for the incident is currently under investigation.

title: Stefon Diggs scans stands for Cardi B after Patriots‚Äô 42-10 win over Jets
content: New England Patriots star Stefon Diggs searched for his partner Cardi B after a decisive win against the New York Jets. This public display of affection garnered varied reactions online. Some praised the gesture as loving, while others questioned its authenticity. The couple had reportedly spent Christmas apart, making their reunion notable.

title: Candace Owens flags new claims questioning Charlie Kirk death timeline
content: Candace Owens says Mitch Snow‚Äôs claims about Charlie Kirk‚Äôs death need verified timelines, not assumptions. Snow, a retired Army medic, says he was at Fort Huachuca and saw key figures. Online users question his memory and details. No official proof confirms his account. Owens asks for solid evidence to settle the debate.

title: Stephen Curry‚Äôs son Canon Curry stuns fans with elite dribbling skills
content: Stephen Curry's son, Canon, showcased remarkable dribbling skills during a Warriors game. The view captivated fans and the clip went viral. Comparisons to 'The Lion King's' Simba emerged, with many predicting a bright future for the young prodigy.  Canon, the youngest of Stephen and Ayesha Curry's four children, is already impressing with his talent.

title: Not Yashasvi or Siraj: These four Indians feature in CA's Test XI of 2025; see full list
content: As the year draws to a close, a number of players delivered notable performances in Test cricket. Based on those displays, Cricket Australia announced its Test XI of the year for 2025.

title: Why Saudi Arabia and the UAE import sand from Australia despite their endless deserts
content: Despite vast deserts, Saudi Arabia and its Gulf neighbours rely on imported construction-grade sand to meet the demands of mega-projects like NEOM and the Burj Khalifa. Desert sand‚Äôs smooth grains are unsuitable for concrete, making riverbed and marine sand essential. This reliance highlights a global sand crisis, environmental pressures, and the urgent need for sustainable alternatives and innovation in construction materials.

title: Sadhus say no to Sunny Leone: Actor‚Äôs New Year show in Mathura cancelled
content: A New Year's Eve DJ performance by Bollywood actress Sunny Leone in Mathura was called off following strong objections from religious leaders. Saints argued the event was inappropriate for the sacred Braj region, known for its divine associations. Despite organizers adhering to all norms and facing a significant financial loss, the program was cancelled to respect local religious sentiments.

title: New Year‚Äôs Eve food traditions around the world to invite luck and joy
content: As the year concludes, diverse global cultures embrace symbolic foods, transforming meals into hopeful rituals. From Spain's midnight grapes for luck to Italy's lentil 'coins' for prosperity, these traditions weave a tapestry of shared wishes. Whether for long life, abundance, or togetherness, these culinary customs offer comfort and a meaningful transition into the new year.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for December 31 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mehul Kothari, DVP ofAnand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers, recommends buying Texmaco Rail & Engineering, CONCOR, and Escorts Kubota. Here are the target levels:

title: Couple's greed for property turned UP home into 5-year prison; gory details emerge
content: A 70-year-old man and his mentally challenged daughter were allegedly held captive and starved for five years by their domestic help in UP's Mahoba district. The case surfaced after the man's death, revealing his emaciated state and his daughter's skeletal condition. Relatives allege the couple sought to seize the family's property.

title: No more subsidy for electric three-wheelers: Govt meets target; ends relief
content: The Centre has ended subsidies for electric three-wheelers after exceeding its penetration target. Support for electric two-wheelers may extend into the next fiscal year as sales are still below the goal. States are now expected to provide incentives, with Delhi poised to announce a package to boost EV adoption.

title: Priyanka Gandhi's son Raihan gets engaged to long-time girlfriend Aviva Baig
content: Raihan Vadra, son of Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and Robert Vadra, has become engaged to his long-time friend Aviva Baig. The private ceremony was attended by close family and friends, with both families having known each other for years. The couple's families are currently celebrating the occasion in Ranthambore, Rajasthan.

title: 'Suryakumar used to message me': Reality TV actor claims; who is Khushi Mukherjee?
content: Speaking at a recent event, Khushi said that Suryakumar used to message her often earlier, but they are no longer in touch. When asked by a reporter if she wanted to date a cricketer, Khushi said she does not want to be linked with any player.

title: 'I‚Äôll urinate in your mouth': Woman SI threatens couple; shunted
content: A UP Police sub-inspector, SI Ratna Rathi, was caught on video verbally abusing and threatening a young couple during a traffic jam in Meerut. The officer, reportedly frustrated by the delay, made highly offensive remarks. The incident, recorded by bystanders, has led to an investigation and her attachment to police lines in Aligarh.

title: Dense Fog Blankets Delhi, Over 100 Flights Affected Amid Low Visibility
content: Dense fog conditions continued to prevail in the national capital on Wednesday, severely impacting daily life across Delhi and the adjoining NCR region. Large parts of the city witnessed low visibility in the early hours of the morning.

title: "No Third-Party Intervention": Sources On China's India-Pak Truce Claim
content: New Delhi has rejected China's claims of mediating a ceasefire between India and Pakistan during the military conflict earlier this year.

title: Thailand Frees 18 Cambodian Soldiers Held Since July Amid Renewed Ceasefire
content: Thailand on Wednesday released 18 Cambodian soldiers it had detained since July under the renewed ceasefire the two countries agreed on the weekend to end a border conflict, Cambodian and Thai authorities said.

title: Khaleda Zia Funeral Updates: Ex-Bangladesh PM To Be Buried Beside Ziaur Rahman
content: Khaleda Zia Funeral Updates: Former Bangladesh prime minister Khaleda Zia died on Tuesday after a prolonged illness. Her funeral will be held on Wednesday following Zohr prayers at Parliament's South Plaza and the adjoining Manik Mia Avenue

title: 41 South African Men Dead In 2 Months From Circumcision Procedures
content: At least 41 young men have died as a result of circumcision procedures as part of traditional initiation activities in South Africa in November and December, authorities said Tuesday.

title: $400,000 Lobster, 40,000 Oysters Stolen In New England Seafood Heist
content: Forty-thousand oysters, lobster worth $400,000 and a cache of crabmeat all were stolen in separate incidents within weeks of each other in New England.

title: Another Hindu Man Killed In Bangladesh. Co-Worker Asked Him "Shall I Shoot"
content: Bajendra Biswas, another Hindu man, was shot dead in Bangladesh's Mymensingh, days after a mob lynched and killed factory worker Dipu Chandra Das over false blasphemy accusations.

title: Khaleda Zia To Be Buried Today, S Jaishankar To Attend Funeral
content: The funeral of Bangladesh's former prime minister Khaleda Zia will be held on Wednesday and she will be buried with full state honours beside her husband, late president Ziaur Rahman, the interim government said on Tuesday.

title: "Settling Hotspots": China Echoes Trump's India-Pakistan Truce Claim
content: After US President Donald Trump, China has claimed credit for mediating peace between India and Pakistan during the military conflict earlier this year, despite New Delhi's pushback, which has repeatedly rejected any third-party mediation.

title: Mumbai Restaurant Fined Rs 50,000 For Mandatory Service Charge
content: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has imposed a fine of Rs 50,000 on China Gate Restaurant Private Limited, which operates the Bora Bora restaurant chain in Mumbai, for illegally levying mandatory service charges on customers.

title: "Human Error" Likely Cause For Mumbai's BEST Bus Accident: Officials
content: A "human error" may have led to the horrific accident involving a bus of Mumbai's civic-run transport undertaking BEST as the more than 6-year-old vehicle appeared to be "mechanically sound", officials said on Tuesday.

title: Two Trains Collide In Uttarakhand's Chamoli, 60 Injured
content: About 60 people were injured a loco train carrying workers and officials collided with a goods train inside Pipalkoti tunnel of the Vishnugad-Pipalkoti Hydro Electric Project tunnel in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district late Tuesday evening, officials sa

title: Russia Says Ukraine Targets Moscow With Drones
content: Ukraine launched a series of drone attacks on Tuesday targeting Moscow, parts of western Russia and annexed Crimea, injuring one person near the Russian capital, Russian authorities said.

title: Journalist Tatiana Schlossberg, Granddaughter Of John F Kennedy, Dies At 35
content: American environmental journalist Tatiana Schlossberg, the granddaughter of late president John F. Kennedy, has died from cancer at the age of 35, her family announced Tuesday.

title: India Imposes Tariff On Steel Products For 3 Years To Curb Cheap Imports
content: India has imposed a three-year import tariff of between 11% and 12% on some steel products, according to a finance ministry order published on Tuesday, as the government aims to curb cheap shipments from China.

title: Elon Musk's xAI Buys Third Building To Expand AI Compute Power
content: Elon Musk said on Tuesday his artificial intelligence startup xAI has bought a third building to expand its infrastructure, aiming to boost training capacity to nearly 2 gigawatts of compute power.

title: 35-Year-Old Man Arrested For Raping Minor Stepdaughter In UP: Cops
content: A 35-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his 13-year-old stepdaughter, police said on Tuesday.

title: Students Across Iran Stage Protest As Economic Crisis Deepens
content: Iranian students staged street protests in Tehran on Tuesday, a day after the capital's shopkeepers demonstrated against economic hardship and won a message of understanding from the president.

title: Not Racism, But Will Probe That Too: Dehradun Cop On Tripura Student's Death
content: The killing of Anjel Chakma, the student from Tripura in Uttarakhand's Dehradun, was probably not a racial attack, the police say, but they also point out that they are exploring all angles including racism.

title: SEBI Cancels Registration Of 'Research Analyst' Found Running Grocery Shop
content: In a shocking case that surprised even the regulator, the Securities and Exchange Board of India has cancelled the registration of a person who was officially listed as a research analyst but was actually running a small grocery shop in Madurai.

title: NFL futures: Seattle Seahawks enter Week 18 as Super Bowl favorites
content: Through 17 weeks of the NFL season, the  Seattle Seahawks  are the new favorites to win the Super Bowl 60, following the  Los Angeles Rams 's loss on "Monday Night Football." The Rams drop to second, as three NFC West teams sit in the top four. The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl at +700. The  San Francisco 49ers  at +850 and the AFC East champion  New England Patriots  at +900. The Seahawks and 49ers meet in Week 18. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.
